instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
this machine came cuz HDMI, wasnt working. i found the issue was with <CHIP>U9750</CHIP>, there was corrosion on <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R9703</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9751</CAPACITOR>. i replaced them all, and now it works, i get video in a external display.

but after that machine became slow, and fans blows at full speed. so i used ASD efi version, and got error on these sensors: TA0P, TM0P, TC0P and Th1H. these are managed by <CHIP>U5780</CHIP>.

I replaced the chip, and the machine is still slow...and i dont see any corrosion on the board anymore. where do i check now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
First try known good trackpad flex/board.

Does it work correctly before you touched RIO board?
If yes, try known good RIO board/flex too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
Already tried good know trackpad and trackpad flex.

already tried 3 good RIO boards, before touching board. after that replaced <CHIP>U9750</CHIP>,  <RESISTOR>R9704</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R9703</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C9751</CAPACITOR>. now i got HDMI,  but machine is slow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issue
threads.message:
"Does it work correctly before you touched RIO board?
---------------------------------------
now i got HDMI, but machine is slow"
It was slow before too???
